title: Everything below the College Football Playoff shaken up in latest bowl projections
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Paul Myerberg breaks down the latest Amway Coaches Poll. USA TODAY

There have been no changes to the projected College Football Playoff field through the first half of the season. Ohio State, Alabama, Oklahoma and Clemson were predicted to make the semifinals in the preseason and all four have held their spots.

The small adjustment this week sees the Sooners slide ahead of the Tigers for the third seed, setting them up for a matchup with the Crimson Tide in the Fiesta Bowl. Clemson would face Ohio State in the Peach Bowl.

However, there has been major changes below those four. And this week's bowl projections saw a significant shift in the New Year's Six bowls with Georgia suffering the first major upset of the season and other expected participants getting shuffled out.

Georgia kicker Rodrigo Blankenship reacts after missing a potential game-tying kick in overtime against South Carolina. (Photo: Curtis Compton, Atlanta Journal-Constitution via AP)

Moving up are three of the surprise teams of the first half - Penn State, Pittsburgh and Baylor. Moving down after losses last week are Georgia, Virginia and Texas.

MIDSEASON AWARDS: Honoring the high and lows from the first half

RE-RANK: Ohio State remains in No. 1 spot, Oklahoma moves up

WINNERS AND LOSERS: Highs and lows from Week 7 in college football

A lot of season still left to be played, but the picture is becoming clearer.

A reminder: Some conferences may not fulfill their bowl allotment. Asterisks denote a replacement pick.
description: The College Football Playoff field of  Alabama, Oklahoma, Clemson and Ohio State remained the same. But the other bowl projections saw major change.
